snippet: The Syria conflict moved to a dangerous new precipice when government troops and civilian supporters blocked unarmed United Nations monitors from looking into a mass killing.
abstract: Syrian conflict escalates to a dangerous new level when government troops and their civilian supporters block unarmed United Nations monitors from investigating a massacre of farm families; monitors are thwarted from reaching tiny hamlet to check on what activists say is the slaying of as many as 78 people, half of them women and children, who were shot, garroted and in some cases burned alive; standoff at government checkpoint seems to symbolize the international paralysis over how to stem the bloodshed.

byline.original: By NEIL MacFARQUHAR and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Neil MacFarquhar reported from Antakya, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Ellen Barry contributed reporting from Moscow, and Alan Cowell from London.

lead_paragraph: The Syria conflict moved to a dangerous new precipice when government troops and civilian supporters blocked unarmed United Nations monitors from looking into a mass killing.

headline.seo: Syrian Conflict Escalates With Reports of New Massacre
headline.main: Syrians Bar U.N. Monitors From a Massacre Inquiry
headline.print_headline: Syrians Bar U.N. Monitors From a Massacre Inquiry

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
